title: Baked Mac and Cheese
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Butter a large baking dish.
Shred all cheeses (cheddar, provolone, gruyere) and keep separate.
Cook elbow macaroni one minute less than al dente according to package directions. Drain.
Drizzle the macaroni with olive oil and stir to coat. Set aside to cool.
Make panko topping: Mix panko crumbs, parmesan, melted butter (56g), and paprika in a small bowl. Set aside.
Combine shredded cheddar, provolone, and gruyere in a bowl and set aside.
Melt both butters (42g unsalted + 42g salted) together in a large saucepan.
Whisk in the flour over low to medium heat and cook until it bubbles and turns lightly golden.
Gradually whisk in the milk and heavy cream until smooth. Keep whisking until the mixture begins to bubble.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Add two cups of the shredded cheese mixture and whisk until smooth.
Add the rest of the shredded cheese and whisk until the sauce becomes very creamy.
Stir in the cooled macaroni until everything is well coated.
Pour half of the mac and cheese into the prepared baking dish.
Sprinkle part of the panko topping over the first layer.
Add the rest of the mac and cheese.
Sprinkle the remaining panko topping over the top.
Bake at 350°F for about 30 minutes, or until bubbly and golden brown.
notes: Volume to weight conversions are approximate: 2 tbsp olive oil ≈ 28g, 4 heaping tbsp flour ≈ 40g, 1.5 cups panko ≈ 90g, 4 tbsp butter ≈ 56g
Total butter used: 84g for sauce + 56g for topping = 140g
For best results, shred cheese fresh rather than using pre-shredded
